amendatorysection.catchline: Governor; disability; removal; examination; conference; members; findings; effect.
amendatorysection.para: Whenever a Governor who has been unable to discharge the duties of the office believes his disability to be removed, he may call a conference consisting of the three persons referred to as members of such a conference in subsection (1) of section 84-127. The three members of the conference shall examine the disabled Governor. After the examination they shall conduct a secret ballot and, by unanimous vote may find the disability removed, and their findings shall immediately be made public.
